com.apizee.apiRTC

Class Conversation

  • Emitter
    • com.apizee.apiRTC.Conversation

  • public class Conversation
extends Emitter

    Users are able to interact with each other by entering a conversation in a N-N fashion. The client is able to listen to conversation events that will be fired once the conversation is joined

      void subscribeToStream(java.lang.String streamId, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function2<? super com.apizee.apiRTC.Conversation.Result,? super java.lang.String,kotlin.Unit> callback)
      Subscribes to a stream. The subscription will automatically stop if the contact publishing the stream unpublishes it. The Conversation#streamAdded event will be fired when the stream becomes available The Conversation#streamRemoved event will be fired when the stream is no longer available The Conversation#hangup event will be fired the subscription is terminated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Conversation

        public Conversation(Session session,
                    java.lang.String name)

        Users are able to interact with each other by entering a conversation in a N-N fashion. The client is able to listen to conversation events that will be fired once the conversation is joined

        name - Conversation name

    • Method Detail

      • join

        public Conversation join(kotlin.jvm.functions.Function2<? super com.apizee.apiRTC.Conversation.Result,? super org.json.JSONObject,kotlin.Unit> callback)

        Connects to a conversation if not already joined Once in the conversation, the user will be able to see other contacts inside it, send and receive messages, publish streams and subscribe to conversation's streams

        Parameters:
        callback - callback to call when join succeeded or failed
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • publish

        public void publish(Stream stream)

        Publish stream to conversation The stream will be able to be subscribed by other contacts within the conversation

        Parameters:
        stream - Stream to publish

      • subscribeToStream

        public void subscribeToStream(java.lang.String streamId,
                              kotlin.jvm.functions.Function2<? super com.apizee.apiRTC.Conversation.Result,? super java.lang.String,kotlin.Unit> callback)

        Subscribes to a stream. The subscription will automatically stop if the contact publishing the stream unpublishes it. The Conversation#streamAdded event will be fired when the stream becomes available The Conversation#streamRemoved event will be fired when the stream is no longer available The Conversation#hangup event will be fired the subscription is terminated.

        Note that multiple Conversation#streamAdded and Conversation#streamRemoved events might be fired in case failure correction.

        Parameters:
        streamId - Identifies the stream to subscribe to.
        callback - callback to call when subscribe succeeded or failed

      • replacePublishedStream

        public void replacePublishedStream(Stream newStream,
                                   Stream oldStream)

        Replaces the currently published stream by a given one.

        Parameters:
        newStream - A new stream.

      • getConversationCall

        public ConversationCall getConversationCall(Stream stream)

        Returns the conversation call handle for a given stream.

        Parameters:
        stream - A stream, result of preceding publish or subscribe call.
        Returns:
        A conversation call handle on success, null otherwise.

      • leave

        public void leave()

        Leaves conversation The user will automatically stop publishing its streams to the conversation and stop subscribing to streams from the conversation. The user will no longer receive events from the conversation The user will no longer see who's within the conversation
